Text:
KMS activator may be detected by some antiviruses.

FatBOB18, you could at least tell what kind of antivirus detected a "virus" and what was its codename. Was it named "a hack tool"?

I hate when people without any understanding post idiotic comments.

I hope this wont be a double post cause my first reply to FatBOB somehow vanished. 

FatBOB, did your antivirus detected a "hack tool"? Please do some investigation on exactly which file was "infected", which AV detected it and what was its codename before posting crap on my torrent.

The installation itself you see here is downloaded from MS MSDN website and the Mini KMS activator is one of frequently used activators for offce 2010. There is no viruses.
Everything works fine so far. Thank you!

So I burned the torrent file to a DVD,  ran the setup.exe. Norton said it blocked something, continued with setup anyways. Everything seems to be working, but I  didnt ever run KMS? I dont know... I'm computer illiterate. Thanks tho

Norton Said:

File:c:usersappdatelocaltemp..... mini-kms_activator_v1.2_office2010_vl_eng_fixed.exe
Threat name: Trojan.ADH
Risk: Very Low
"..is a detection technology designed to detect entirely new maleware threats without traditional signatures..." some other crap

UPDATE: IMO Don't Download This. I downloaded the torrent on another computer, burned the files to a disk and installed MO on this laptop. This laptop was just rebooted prior to instalation ~ clean computer. Been having problems connecting to the internet on campus.. would not connect even with a full signal. Restored windows (removed MO) and now it connects fine. I blame the torrent. Dont DL
